In Islam, it is a religious obligation to migrate to non-Muslim lands with the purpose of spreading Islam and establishing it as the dominant system.

This idea goes straight back to Muhammad himself, who fled Mecca to Medina in 622 AD, not to escape war, but to strategically build power. 

That migration, known as the original Hijrah, marks the official beginning of the Islamic calendar, that‚Äôs how central and celebrated it is in Islam.

From that moment on, Hijrah became a model for Islamic conquest:

‚ÄúAnd whoever emigrates for the cause of Allah will find many locations and abundance.‚Äù ‚Äî Quran 4:100

‚ÄúWe will conquer Europe, we will conquer America, not through the sword, but through Da‚Äôwah (proselytizing) and Hijrah.‚Äù
